result.execSummary:
The defendant Gerald John Goebel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: straight time, with credit for 84 days time served, consecutive to COUNT 2.

miscConds.notes:
AS TO EACH COUNT:  Restitution set at $0.
Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected during term of probation;  nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.
Mental health assessment and  cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications only in dosages prescribed by a treating physician.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing.
No contact with Cheryl R., Jeffrey L. 
No alcohol or controlled substances.

Cooperate with agent.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
Anger management assessment; cooperate with any treatment deemed appropriate.

AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.

records.addlTxt: Request for payment of $34 witness fees for witness Jeffery M.L. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26211713 in court 2x on 8/12/15, 8/13/15.
Request for payment of $ 17 witness fees for witness Cheryl A.R.processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26211712 in court 1x on 8/12/15.

Defendant Gerald John Goebel in court with attorney Eugene Bykhovsky.  Defendant Gerald John Goebel in custody.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to NO CONTEST. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve 8 MONTHS in the House of Corrections straight time, with credit for 84 days time served, consecutive to COUNT 2, with credit for 84 days time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 2 YEARS with the following conditions:
-Restitution set at $0 
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected during term of probation;  nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Anger management assessment; cooperate with any treatment deemed appropriate
-Mental health assessment and  cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications only in dosages prescribed by a treating physician
-No contact with Cheryl R., Jeffrey L. 
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve 90 DAYS, straight time in the House of Corrections, consecutive to COUNT 1.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION,  for a period of 2 YEARS with the following conditions:  
-Restitution set at $0 
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected during term of probation;  nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Anger management assessment; cooperate with any treatment deemed appropriate
-Mental health assessment and  cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications only in dosages prescribed by a treating physician
-No contact with Cheryl R., Jeffrey L. 
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances


Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Pretrial Credit sheet
State's Witness List received and filed.
State's Requested Jury Instructions received and filed.
Court does not accept defendants plea and waives the entering of plea.

Defendant Gerald John Goebel in court with attorney Eugene Bykhovsky.  Defendant Gerald John Goebel in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court continues colloquy with defendant regarding the elements pursuant to the charges lodged against him pursuant to the Amended Information.  Defendant does not admit to facts of the complaint.  Court will not accept defendants plea and ordered matter to commence with a Jury Trial on 8-13-2015 at 9:30 a.m.
Defendant enters a guilty plea to the amended charge.  Court conducts colloquy with the defendant regarding elements of offense.  Court unable to accept plea and adjourns matter to 1:30 p.m. today.

Defendant Gerald John Goebel in court with attorney Eugene Bykhovsky.  Defendant Gerald John Goebel in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Information received and filed.  Defense/Defendant waives reading of the Amended Information and enters a plea of not guilty.
Defendant's Witness List received and filed.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion in Limine to Exclude Use of Defendant's Statements at Trial received and filed.

Attorney Eugene Bykhovsky in court, defendant Gerald John Goebel not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pretrial conducted.  Matter to remain calendared for jury trial.

Defendant Gerald John Goebel in court with attorney Eugene Bykhovsky.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference conducted.  Defendant made a Speedy Trial Demand on 6/3/15.  Matter calendared for Final Pretrial and Jury Trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Gerald John Goebel in court with attorney Eugene Bykhovsky.  Defendant Gerald John Goebel in custody.  Ronald Dague for Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE POINT for Supervision.
Court orders defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY and to be monitored by drug tests and portable breathalyzers. 
Court orders no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Cheryl R  or her address.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Gerald John Goebel in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Gerald John Goebel in custody.  
Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Defendant enters a plea of  Not Guilty as to Count 2.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he  may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
